byline.contributor: Eric Schmitt reported from Washington, and Ben Hubbard from Reyhanli, Turkey. Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Reyhanli.
byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and BEN HUBBARD

abstract: Defense Dept, prompted by crippling attack on American-trained rebel group by Islamic State fighters, announces new approach to combating extremists in Syria; program will focus on improving intelligence, intensifying training and increasing size of force to be deployed.
lead_paragraph: The proposed changes come after a Syrian affiliate of Al Qaeda attacked the rebel group of the first 54 Syrian graduates of the military program.

headline.main: U.S. Revamping Rebel Force Fighting ISIS in Syria
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Revamp a Rebel Force Combating ISIS

snippet: The proposed changes come after a Syrian affiliate of Al Qaeda attacked the rebel group of the first 54 Syrian graduates of the military program.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
